document.discussion_title: Akamai Technologies’ (AKAM) Hold Rating Reiterated at JPMorgan Chase & Co.
document.topic_text: Tweet Akamai Technologies, Inc. (NASDAQ:AKAM) ‘s stock had its “hold” rating reiterated by analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co. in a research note issued to investors on Monday, Analyst Ratings.Net reports. In other Akamai Technologies news, CEO F Thomson Leighton bought 96,521 shares of the stock in a transaction on Tuesday, February 16th. The stock was purchased at an average price of $51.79 per share, with a total value of $4,998,822.59. The purchase was disclosed in a legal filing with the Securities & Exchange Commission, which is available at this link . Also, CFO James M. Benson sold 17,521 shares of the business’s stock in a transaction dated Thursday, February 18th. The stock was sold at an average price of $51.94, for a total value of $910,040.74. Following the transaction, the chief financial officer now directly owns 37,375 shares of the company’s stock, valued at approximately $1,941,257.50. The disclosure for this sale can be found here . Shares of Akamai Technologies ( NASDAQ:AKAM ) traded down 0.57% during mid-day trading on Monday, reaching $50.84. The company’s stock had a trading volume of 965,436 shares. Akamai Technologies has a 52 week low of $39.43 and a 52 week high of $78.44. The stock has a market capitalization of $9.00 billion and a price-to-earnings ratio of 28.56. The company’s 50-day moving average is $54.00 and its 200-day moving average is $55.49. Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ:AKAM) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Tuesday, February 9th. The technology infrastructure company reported $0.72 earnings per share for the quarter, beating analysts’ consensus estimates of $0.62 by $0.10. During the same period in the prior year, the company earned $0.70 EPS. The business had revenue of $579 million for the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $569.28 million. Akamai Technologies’s quarterly revenue was up 8.0% on a year-over-year basis. Equities analysts predict that Akamai Technologies will post $2.70 EPS for the current year. A number of other research analysts have also issued reports on the stock. KeyBanc reduced their target price on shares of Akamai Technologies from $86.00 to $75.00 and set an “outperform” rating for the company in a research note on Monday, January 11th. Vetr lowered shares of Akamai Technologies from a “sell” rating to a “strong sell” rating and set a $50.47 target price for the company. in a research note on Wednesday, March 23rd. Piper Jaffray reissued an “overweight” rating and set a $69.00 target price on shares of Akamai Technologies in a research note on Thursday, April 7th. Deutsche Bank reissued a “buy” rating on shares of Akamai Technologies in a research note on Wednesday, January 13th. Finally, Morgan Stanley reissued an “equal weight” rating and set a $60.00 target price on shares of Akamai Technologies in a research note on Wednesday, February 10th. Two research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, ten have issued a hold rating, fifteen have issued a buy rating and one has assigned a strong buy rating to the company. The stock presently has a consensus rating of “Buy” and an average price target of $65.45. A number of hedge funds and institutional investors have modified their holdings of AKAM. Appleton Partners Inc. MA increased its position in shares of Akamai Technologies by 2.6% in the fourth quarter. Appleton Partners Inc. MA now owns 100,753 shares of the technology infrastructure company’s stock valued at $5,303,000 after buying an additional 2,508 shares during the last quarter. Capital Fund Management S.A. acquired a new position in shares of Akamai Technologies during the fourth quarter valued at approximately $15,472,000. New England Research & Management increased its position in shares of Akamai Technologies by 41.4% in the fourth quarter. New England Research & Management now owns 15,205 shares of the technology infrastructure company’s stock valued at $800,000 after buying an additional 4,455 shares during the last quarter. Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset Management CO. LTD. increased its position in shares of Akamai Technologies by 6.6% in the fourth quarter. Mitsubishi UFJ Kokusai Asset Management CO. LTD. now owns 23,664 shares of the technology infrastructure company’s stock valued at $1,245,000 after buying an additional 1,459 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Janus Capital Management increased its position in shares of Akamai Technologies by 354.7% in the third quarter. Janus Capital Management now owns 462,973 shares of the technology infrastructure company’s stock valued at $31,973,000 after buying an additional 361,154 shares during the last quarter. Akamai Technologies, Inc is a provider of cloud services for delivering, optimizing and securing online content and business applications. Its solutions include delivery of conventional content on Websites, tools that support the delivery and operation of cloud-based applications, as well as security solutions, and live and on-demand streaming video capabilities. //www.americanbankingnews.com/2016/04/25/akamai-technologies-akam-hold-rating-reiterated-at-jpmorgan-chase-co/ Akamai Technologies Inc. Akamai Technologies Inc.
